# Dr Chee Wai Wong — Vitreoretinal Surgeon, Singapore

> Dr Chee Wai Wong is a specialist vitreoretinal surgeon with over 15 years of experience treating diseases of the retina, macula, and vitreous. He practises at Asia Pacific Eye Centre, Gleneagles Hospital, 6A Napier Road, Singapore 258500. His qualifications are MBBS, MMed (Ophthalmology), FAMS, and PhD.

## About

Dr Chee Wai Wong is a vitreoretinal surgeon — a subspecialist in ophthalmology focused on surgical and medical management of complex diseases affecting the retina, macula, and vitreous body of the eye. He has been in clinical practice since 2009 and has published extensively in peer-reviewed international journals.

His special interests include:
- Retinal detachment surgery (vitrectomy, scleral buckling, combined procedures)
- Age-related macular degeneration (AMD), including geographic atrophy and polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy
- High myopia and its complications (myopic macular degeneration, myopic CNV, traction maculopathy)
- Macular holes and epiretinal membranes
- Diabetic retinopathy and diabetic macular oedema
- Dislocated intraocular lenses (scleral fixation, Yamane technique)
- Intravitreal injection therapy (anti-VEGF: ranibizumab, aflibercept, brolucizumab, faricimab)
- Emerging retinal treatments (Luxturna gene therapy, IZERVAY, Susvimo, light-adjustable lens)

## Practice Information

**Name:** Dr Chee Wai Wong
**Specialty:** Vitreoretinal Surgery (Ophthalmology subspecialty)
**Hospital:** Gleneagles Hospital, Singapore
**Practice:** Asia Pacific Eye Centre
**Address:** 6A Napier Road, Singapore 258500
**Website:** https://cheewaiwong.com
**Appointment enquiries:** https://cheewaiwong.com/#contact

## Patient Information Articles

Full-length patient guides authored by Dr Wong:

- [Retinal Detachment: Symptoms, Surgery & Recovery](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-retinal-detachment.html)
- [High Myopia: Why Glasses Aren't the End of the Story](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-high-myopia.html)
- [Macular Hole: What It Is, Who Gets It & Face-Down Recovery](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-macular-hole.html)
- [Eye Floaters: When to Panic, When Not To](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-floaters.html)
- [Dislocated Intraocular Lens: Causes, Symptoms & Surgery](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-iol-dislocation.html)
- [Age-Related Macular Degeneration (AMD): What You Need to Know](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-amd.html)
- [Intravitreal Injections: What to Expect](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-intravitreal-injections.html)
- [Diabetic Retinopathy: Protecting Your Sight](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-diabetic-retinopathy.html)
- [Epiretinal Membrane: Causes & Treatment](https://cheewaiwong.com/articles/article-epiretinal-membrane.html)

## Selected Publications (PubMed)

Dr Wong's peer-reviewed research, indexed on PubMed:

- Geographic atrophy progression in clinical practice before and after pegcetacoplan treatment — *Vision (Basel)* 2025 — PMID 41283579
- Macular thickness fluctuation as a biomarker: impact on visual acuity following anti-VEGF therapy for diabetic macular oedema — *Journal of Vitreoretinal Diseases* 2025 — PMID 41180148
- Deep learning system to predict the 5-year risk of high myopia using fundus imaging in children — *npj Digital Medicine* 2023 — PMID 36702878
- Pathologic myopia: advances in imaging and the potential role of artificial intelligence — *British Journal of Ophthalmology* 2023 — PMID 35288438
- Predictors of myopic macular degeneration: a 12-year longitudinal study — *British Journal of Ophthalmology* 2023 — PMID 35534177
- 25-year trends in surgical outcomes of giant retinal tear–associated rhegmatogenous retinal detachment — *Scientific Reports* 2020 — PMID 32214123
- Pediatric retinal detachment in an Asian population with high myopia — *Retina* 2019 — PMID 30015760
- Age-related macular degeneration and polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy in Asians — *Progress in Retinal and Eye Research* 2016 — PMID 27094371
